content.description: According to the United States Social Security Administration (<math alttext="S S A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>SSA</mtext></math>), for children born <math alttext="18" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn></math> years ago, the following table gives the percentage of children with a first name beginning with the letters A–C, D–J, K–M, and N–Z.
content.question: Percentages from the <math alttext="S S A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>SSA</mtext></math> Beginning letter of first name A–C D–J K–M N–Z Percent of names recorded by the <math alttext="S S A" overflow="scroll"><mtext>SSA</mtext></math>beginning with that letter <math alttext="25.65%" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.65</mn><mo>%</mo></math> <math alttext="26.30%" overflow="scroll"><mn>26.30</mn><mo>%</mo></math> <math alttext="25.10%" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.10</mn><mo>%</mo></math> <math alttext="22.95%" overflow="scroll"><mn>22.95</mn><mo>%</mo></math> Daphne, a senior at a large high school, will investigate whether the distribution of the beginning letter of first names of students at her high school who were born <math alttext="18" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn></math> years ago is consistent with the percentages from the Social Security Administration. She took a random sample of <math alttext="80" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn></math> students from her school who were born <math alttext="18" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn></math> years ago. Daphne recorded the number of students with a first name beginning with the letters A–C, D–J, K–M, and N–Z. The results are shown in the following table. Numbers from Daphne’s Sample Beginning letter of first name A–C D–J K–M N–Z Number of names in Daphne’s sample beginning with that letter <math alttext="17" overflow="scroll"><mn>17</mn></math> <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn></math> <math alttext="15" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn></math> <math alttext="23" overflow="scroll"><mn>23</mn></math> Assuming the conditions for inference are met, what is the appropriate chi-square test and calculation of the test statistic for her investigation?

choices.label: A <math alttext="chi squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>χ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> goodness-of-fit test; <math alttext="chi squared equals, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 17 minus 25.65, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 25.65, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 26.30, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 26.30, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 25.10, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator, 25.10, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 23 minus 22.95, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 22.95, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mi>χ</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>17</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>25.65</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>25.65</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>25</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>26.30</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>26.30</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>15</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>25.10</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>25.10</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>23</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>22.95</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>22.95</mn> </mfrac> </math>

A <math alttext="chi squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>χ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> goodness-of-fit test; <math alttext="chi squared equals, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 17 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 23 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator, 20, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mi>χ</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>17</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>25</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>15</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>23</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> </math>

A <math alttext="chi squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>χ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> goodness-of-fit test; <math alttext="chi squared equals, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 17 minus 20.52, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20.52, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 21.04, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 21.04, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 20.08, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator, 20.08, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 23 minus 18.36, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 18.36, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mi>χ</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>17</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20.52</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20.52</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>25</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>21.04</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>21.04</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>15</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20.08</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20.08</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>23</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>18.36</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>18.36</mn> </mfrac> </math>

A <math alttext="chi squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>χ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> test for independence; <math alttext="chi squared equals, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 17 minus 25.65, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 25.65, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 26.30, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 26.30, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 25.10, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator, 25.10, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 23 minus 22.95, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 22.95, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mi>χ</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>17</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>25.65</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>25.65</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>25</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>26.30</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>26.30</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>15</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>25.10</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>25.10</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>23</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>22.95</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>22.95</mn> </mfrac> </math>

A <math alttext="chi squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>χ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> test for independence; <math alttext="chi squared equals, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 17 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 23 minus 20, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator, 20, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mi>χ</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>17</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>25</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>15</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>23</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20</mn> </mfrac> </math>

content.answer: A <math alttext="chi squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>χ</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> goodness-of-fit test; <math alttext="chi squared equals, the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 17 minus 20.52, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20.52, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 25 minus 21.04, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 21.04, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 15 minus 20.08, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator, 20.08, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 23 minus 18.36, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 18.36, end fraction" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mi>χ</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>17</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20.52</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20.52</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>25</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>21.04</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>21.04</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>15</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>20.08</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>20.08</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>23</mn> <mo>-</mo> <mn>18.36</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mn>18.36</mn> </mfrac> </math>

topic.text: 8.2: Setting up a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
